<<<<<<< HEAD
The prologue and epilogue to the new comedy, called, The English Fryer, or, The town sparks. Licensed, March 17. 1689. J.F. Crown, Mr. (John), 1640?-1712.
1 sheet (2 p.).
Printed for John Am[o]ry; and published by Randal Taylor, London, : 1690.
Verse: "Heaven to the Muses well may coyn deny;". With an advertisement at the bottom of p.2. Attributed to John Crown. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
